reviews.text: Thanks to Google maps, it is a pretty easy gravesite to find. The maps did get a little confused, so when in doubt go uphill and near the bluff. Daniel has a nice view of the river and state capitol.
Great for tours, and while you visit the kids can play Pokémon Go. More than 30 Pokéstops within the gates. Roads are narrow, so please be careful.
Beautiful location with awesome views.  Entire cemetery is a historical overload !  Helpful office staff.
Attractive gravesite, but the tall black fence around the monument makes it difficult to frame a good picture...
Interesting old cemetery and Daniel Boone grave. Great view of the Capital and Frankfort!

It is always a fantastic place to go! Even young and the old alike are all welcome to come attend this wonderful history of our state. I sure hope you can join one dayM for you will not be disappointed! Please check this place out it’s definitely a must thing to do here in town!
I actually work at the Kentucky History Center. It's a nice place to be. Nice people. Love the old pictures and artifacts. Very educational and interesting.
The best historical society in Frankfort Kentucky. Great helpful local staff. The traveling exhibition are outstanding presentations.  I look forward to seeing more experiences this year.
Friendly and helpful staff. Museum was bigger than I expected. I would definitely recommend this place. There's a little area for little kids to play and they also have a gift shop.
This is a very nice museum.  Everyone should take a tour at least once a year.  The staff are very nice.😊
This Santa was wonderful. Spent real time talking with the children and nice tour of the historic governor mansion.
Well managed. Let you have the run of the place, see all the neat hideaways.
Amazing house, so cool that you can just freely walk around and take your time. Definitely a must if you like history and old houses.
It was interesting to see the inside of a old beautiful building that used to house our state governors.

This a really cool place with detailed history about the governors of ND. The wormwood is beautiful. Seeing the different wallpapers of past decades will be interesting. Do not forget to check out the carriage house!

Absolutely a wonderful tour to add to your trip. Our tour guide, Megan was very knowledgeable and very patient with our questions we had! Orlando Brown House is very worth seeing, it's part of the tour. Thank you for having our family!
Fantastic place to visit if you love history and a ghost story. Kentucky history tours include this place as a must see on their tours. You will love the history.

Tours begin at the John Brown house at 1:30 p.m. They currently only do one tour daily according to Kate. She stated that they used to do more, but cut back due to interest levels. This seems a shame, since I think it would be great if many more took time to take this tour. Tours are conducted Monday-Saturday mid-March through late November according a brochure I got at the Frankfort Visitor's Center.

I enjoyed taking a guided tour of the Liberty Hall Historic Site on Tuesday, April 3rd, 2018. Two tour guides conducted the tour. Since it was apparently Meghan's first tour, she was accompanied by an experienced tour guide (Kate). I felt blessed to get information from two guides.

Kate and Meghan provided much information about the house, its artwork, furniture, and other furnishings, was well as the Brown family history. The guides even discussed a ghost allegedly seen by multiple people, though they apparently hadn't seen it. This interesting and educational tour provided much information.

In addition to the rooms of the house, the tour included the laundry building and kitchen, which were near the house.

I enjoyed each part of the tour, seeing the furnishings of the various rooms and learning about them. But, what most impressed me were the contents of an upstairs room in the John Brown house that at some point had been converted into a library. This room contained numerous shelves of old books that had belonged to the Brown family.

Kate stated that a two-year grant had aided in cataloging/organizing the books. In many books I saw pieces of paper with what appeared to be Dewey Decimal numbers. Maybe they were in all the books. I could read the titles on the spines of some books. But due to their age, etc., I did not ask to remove them from the shelves or to even touch them.

It would be great if a complete listing of the books (title, author, publication date) were posted publicly online. Researchers and many others (at least me!) would enjoy this I think. I saw some volumes from what appeared to be a huge six-volume dictionary; it would be interesting to see what those volumes and others contain.

In addition to the John Brown house, the tour also included the gardens/grounds, as well as the next door Orlando Brown house. Meghan conducted the Orlando Brown house portion of the tour solo. That portion went fairly quickly since it only covered the downstairs, and Meghan noted that the Orlando Brown house and its contents were not as notable as the John Brown house and its contents. Kate came in during the Orlando Brown portion of the tour, and in response to my question, said the upstairs of the former Orlando Brown home was now used for offices, though it originally had been bedrooms.

The guided tour of the Liberty Hall Historic Site costs $6 for adults and $3 for children of certain ages. The site is conveniently located near downtown Frankfort.

I'm not sure how many persons can take the tour at once. About 6-8 people were on the tour I took.

The guides patiently answered all the questions from me and the others on the tour. I asked many questions myself. At least a few times, I interrupted a guide to ask a question and perhaps interrupted her train of thought. I apologize for that!

I recommend persons in the Frankfort area consider taking time for this tour, especially if they are interested in early Frankfort history. My guides provided many interesting facts during a tour that probably lasted only an hour or less, including the questions and answers. Even children of elementary school age would enjoy much of this tour in my opinion.

One of the premier events of Derby Season, Bourbon & Browns at Liberty Hall Historic Site celebrates the historical contributions of the family of Senator John Brown, Kentucky's first US Senator after becoming a state, and the significance of bourbon and it's history in Kentucky. The annual fundraiser benefits the historic Liberty Hall site which includes the Orlando Brown House, Senator John Brown's son, and 4 acres of sprawling gardens. Bourbon tastings, bluegrass music, a live & silent auctions, as well as appetizers and food, cap off the evening and help transport the attendees back to a simpler time in Kentucky's history.
Very friendly and personal tour. Hostess was extremely welcoming.

Absolutely a wonderful tour to add to your trip. Our tour guide, Megan was very knowledgeable and very patient with our questions we had! Orlando Brown House is very worth seeing, it's part of the tour. Thank you for having our family!
Fantastic place to visit if you love history and a ghost story. Kentucky history tours include this place as a must see on their tours. You will love the history.

Very friendly and personal tour. Hostess was extremely welcoming.

This is a nice place to come for a walk. There are very few visitors most days. Today there were only three cars when I arrived. I only saw two people on the trails. I hiked the Red Trail today, which is a nice 2 mile walk when combined with the yellow Trail. For a Wildlife Preserve though you see very little wildlife. I saw evidence of owls and heard a woodpecker and heard a few wild birds, but that was it. There is no entrance fee though they suggest a donation of $4. Also the Buckley Wildlife Sanctuary is now run by Life Adventure Center of Woodford County. Basically this is a good place to come if you want to get away from it all for a little while and just have some solitude in nature.
EDIT: Definitely more wildlife now, as Whitetail Deer have come back. I see a few every time I'm out there!
Nice shady trails. Pavilion for having lunch or group activities. Very peaceful!
Saw more wildlife while driving to and from here than I saw there. Nice if you just want to take a hike.
Lots of hiking trails and wildlife. Great for spotting deer, wild turkey, and other species of birds.
Was really disappointed.
Loved this little place for coffee and breakfast. Great atmosphere, cozy with books, soft furniture, and a tiki bar! Really need to go back for cocktails and live music!
Delicious flat scones and cozy. Good coffee, too. Connected to a bookstore and arts and gift store. I like it.

I stopped in to get a coffee on my way to an interview. The service was great and the coffee was  the best I've had outside of Philadelphia (white mocha with almond milk). I enjoyed it so much I stopped for lunch on my way back to my car! Highly recommend

Good local coffee shop. Prices are a little high for the sizes, but unfortunately with so many big companies the local businesses have to have a higher price. The staff have always been friendly when I have visited, and at the holidays you can get boozy hot cocoa or eggnog, and who doesn't love that! I recommend you check them out if in town. Chill with a cup of coffee and a book that you just bought from Poor Richard's Bookstore next door 😉
Nice quiet coffee and backed goods joint perfect stop of beginning of a busy day

They doing baby ear piercing here. The staff that work at the jewellery store are really friendly. They ways gave two staff to pierce baby ears as they do both at the same time to prevent added stress to the child which is perfect

Ignite Records is the best record store in the city. A real vinyl cavern that is packed with fairly priced records to suit a wide range of tastes. Rich (the owner) is a real gent, very knowledgeable and accommodating. The store is friendly and welcoming. Important we keep this indie going!
Legendary Birmingham fixture! Great place to get alternative/rock clothing and accessories  in an iconic location in the centre of town for nearly 50 years.

I have been going to Oasis for over 10 years now and every time you go in it is exciting, literally like a kid in a sweet shop. There is always something new and exciting going on. Highly recommend it!

Oasis has lost it appeal and is no longer a fashion markets. It's now full of rude and over priced tattoo parlours and pretentious "clothing shops". Not to mention the shops selling drug paraphernalia. 

Both inside and out the markets are rundown and are stuck in the 1980s and is in need of updating and bring in to this millennium. 
The markets also attracts the wrong kind of people and is a center of anti-social behaviour. I have often seen the police and security patrolling and moving people on. 

The Oasis markets are full of empty stalls and shops, which adds to the rundown feeling.

In conclusion, I would not recommend visting the markets for this reason.

Love walking into a Starbucks and smelling the fresh coffee. This location was clean and the staff friendly. Coffee was made to order and correctly made for this picky coffee drinker lol. This spot has an area for when you are wanting to socialize or break out the computer/books and do some studying while sipping on a latte. Only problem I seen was the drive through and parking area are very tight but couldn't take a star away just for that. Keep it up at this location cause my little girl and I will definitely be back for our coffee.
Always fast, friendly, and informative! Their coffee is great and their snacks are always yummy! Mobile pickup through their app is always very convenient as well!

Yummy but prices need to stop going up, they  are beyond being a very successful business that has millions of people addicted and stopping for ine of their many yummy beverages and foods almost every day like its crack, stop being greedy with the cost increase of everything, PLEASE. I want to be able to afford my coffee "crack" lol just playing, kinda. Attention there's no illegal drugs served at any Starbucks facility
... that I'm aware of!
Very friendly service. Got the order correct. Fast.
Rude, impersonal staff, slow service, dirty restrooms. The food is blah, you get better quality food at much lower prices at McDonalds or any of the other fast food chains in the area.
